value.title: Biden taps Brenda Mallory to lead White House Council on Environmental Quality
value.excerpt: In Wilmington, Del., on Dec. 19, President-elect Joe Biden introduced Obama administration veteran Brenda Mallory as his pick to serve as the first Black chair of the White House Council on Environmental Quality.

value.title: Jim Carrey hanging up his Joe Biden ‘SNL’ impression
value.excerpt: Jim Carrey is turning in his aviators and giving up his gig of impersonating Joe Biden on "Saturday Night Live."

value.title: Sir David Attenborough on Joe Biden, Christmas wrapping... and flamingos
value.excerpt: Like many of us, Sir David Attenborough has had to adapt to new ways of working since the coronavirus pandemic took hold this spring. For his latest series, the 93-year-old - who has been shielding - had to record some of his voiceovers from his home in south-west London.

value.title: Mr. Biden shouldn’t be the only target for Catholics
value.excerpt: Are the religious leaders condemning President-elect Joe Biden for his abortion stance also condemning Attorney General William P. Barr, who is also Catholic, for his rabid haste to execute federal prisoners before Jan.

value.title: Biden transition head speaks out on 'difficult and intense' process
value.excerpt: Biden’s longtime chief of staff and a former senator, says that leading Biden’s transition team “has been the most difficult and intense workload that I've ever experienced.” "I thought we [saw] the most difficult transition because of the Great Recession,

value.title: ‘He called me kiddo’: Jill Biden says WSJ essay was ‘such a surprise’
value.excerpt: "One of the things I'm most proud of is my doctorate," incoming First Lady Jill Biden told Stephen Colbert while responding to the WSJ's controversial op-ed.

value.title: Joe Biden Wears a ‘Kick Me’ Sign
value.excerpt: Critics like AOC and Sanders believe there is no price to be paid, and benefits to be gained, by publicly pressuring the new administration.

value.title: Betsy DeVos tells Education Department employees to 'resist' Biden administration, report says
value.excerpt: The education secretary under President Trump reportedly told agency workers to “be the resistance" against changes they believe could hurt students.

value.title: Biden to tap North Carolina environmental regulator Regan to head EPA
value.excerpt: The pick is a major nod to the party's progressive wing that pushed Biden's team to emphasize minority and poor communities facing threats from pollution.

value.title: Exclusive: New agreement needed to revive Iran nuclear deal under Biden, IAEA chief says
value.excerpt: Reviving Iran's nuclear deal under U.S. President-elect Joe Biden would require striking a new agreement setting out how Iran's breaches should be reversed, U.N. atomic watchdog chief Rafael Grossi said.

value.title: Politics live updates: Biden to introduce Buttigieg as incoming Transportation chief Wednesday
value.excerpt: Pete Buttigieg is scheduled to appear with Biden Wednesday for a formal announcement. On Twitter, he called the nomination a "tremendous opportunity."

value.title: Fact check: Laptop repairman at center of Hunter Biden saga is alive
value.excerpt: Some users on Facebook have falsely claimed John Paul Mac Isaac — the laptop repairman at the center of the Hunter Biden laptop saga — was found dead.

value.title: ‘In Bad Shape and Getting Worse,’ Guantánamo Poses Headaches for Biden
value.excerpt: The new administration confronts decaying infrastructure and a military justice system moving at a glacial pace.

value.title: Judith Heumann: 'Biden is committed to involving disabled people in his administration'
value.excerpt: The US activist on Covid’s impact and her starring role in Crip Camp, the documentary charting the birth of the disability rights movement

value.title: 'Democracy prevailed': Biden after official win
value.excerpt: Biden after official win. Posted . Democrat Joe Biden called on Americans to "turn the page" on the Trump era in a prime-time speech on Monday (D

value.title: A talk with France’s ambassador: On Biden, climate accord and restoring allies’ trust
value.excerpt: The Times speaks with Philippe Etienne, France's envoy to the U.S., on Biden's promise to rejoin the five-year-old Paris Accord that Trump disavowed.

value.title: VC Daily: Venture Firms Ready for Payday; NVCA Lobbies Biden With Letter; SoftBank Ends Year on High Note
value.excerpt: Last week, the National Venture Capital Association sent a letter to President-elect Joe Biden to get a lobbying head start.

value.title: In Latin America, a Biden White House faces a rising China
value.excerpt: Donald Trump was clear with Latin America during his four-year administration: don't do business with China. The message failed to hit home.

value.title: Alexander: 'It looks very much like the electors will vote for Joe Biden'
value.excerpt: Sen. Lamar Alexander (R-Tenn.) tells Chuck Todd that there shouldn't be any doubt about who won the 2020 presidential election after the Electoral College votes on Monday.

value.title: Analysis: Senate 'gangs' show Biden what's possible, and not
value.excerpt: Senators met day after day, night after night, trying to hammer out a framework for a $900 billion-plus COVID-19 aid and economic relief package

value.title: Biden: Cabinet picks from Obama era mean 'bold new thinking'
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden on Friday introduced a series of key picks for his new government that drew heavily from the Obama administration

value.title: Statement: Atlanta mayor turned down Biden's Cabinet offer
value.excerpt: A spokesperson for Atlanta Mayor Keisha Lance Bottoms says the prominent Democrat turned down an opportunity to serve in President-elect Joe Biden’s Cabinet

value.title: An Opinion Writer Argued Jill Biden Should Drop the ‘Dr.’ (Few Were Swayed.)
value.excerpt: Many women said Joseph Epstein’s suggestion in The Wall Street Journal was blatantly sexist and underscored the way men often dismiss women’s credentials.

value.title: BAKER sends back POLICE REFORM bill — CLARK presses BIDEN on plastics — ROLLINS on U.S. ATTORNEY buzz
value.excerpt: He's not in office yet, but Rep. Katherine Clark is already calling on President-elect Joe Biden to address the world's "indisputable plastic pollution crisis." Clark penned a letter with Oregon Sen.

value.title: In leaked audio, Joe Biden says 'defund the police' was used to 'beat the living hell' out of Democrats
value.excerpt: WASHINGTON — President-elect Joe Biden told civil rights leaders in a meeting on Tuesday he thought Republicans used the "defund the police" movement to defeat Democrats in down

value.title: Biden facing pressure to pick Congresswoman Deb Haaland as Interior Secretary
value.excerpt: Tribal leaders, progressives and prominent women have called for Biden to pick Haaland as his interior secretary.

value.title: Biden taps Susan Rice as domestic policy advisor, picks former Obama Chief of Staff Denis McDonough for VA
value.excerpt: McDonough is nominated to lead the sprawling Department of Veterans Affairs, and Susan Rice is Biden's choice for the White House Domestic Policy Council.

value.title: Biden has reportedly chosen Capitol Hill staffer Katherine Tai as his US trade representative
value.excerpt: If she is picked, the House Ways and Means chief trade lawyer would be the first woman of color to hold the position.

value.title: Joe Biden's centrist dilemma: Police groups say he's gone too far left; activists say he hasn't gone far enough
value.excerpt: Conflicting interests from police and social justice groups will test Joe Biden's reputation as a centrist as he tries to implement police reform.

value.title: AP sources: Biden picks Fudge for housing, Vilsack for USDA
value.excerpt: President-elect Joe Biden has selected Ohio Rep. Marcia Fudge as his housing and urban development secretary and former Agriculture Secretary Tom Vilsack to reprise that role in his administration
